answers.answer: You arent much overweight at all!  Have you gone to a BMI website to check that out?  I highly doubt it was the reason for your miscarriage irregardless.  You are the height and weight my mother is right now (she's 43).  While getting fit and eating right could only benefit your pregancy, your doctor should not have made you feel this small amount of weight was the cause of yoru miscarriage.  The fact is, he likely cannot pinpoint the cause at all and 7 weeks is very early.  Please don't beat yourself up over this, odds are it was something in the fetus's genetic code before it was your weight.  I really think you should find a new, more supportive doctor before you conceive again, this man sounds like a jerk!

Also I am very sorry for your loss, I lost a child years ago and it was devastating.  I went on to make a healthy baby girl who is my whole world today.  Once again, getting fit can only help a pregnancy but you are not to blame for your miscarraige and don't believe that.

Thanks for your support Nikki... It caught me completely off guard that he would say such a thing. I remember going to a dr. appt. with my best friend who is ( 5'2 215), and she asked if she should loose weight before trying to conceive, and her doctor told her, it wasn't that big of an issue, as long as she was healthy and didnt have any major health problems... i am def. finding a new dr. he has been really reluctant to refer me to an RE, to help me see what is going on with me....

That is sad! You aren't very overweight at all. Sometimes I think it's just an excuse for docs to push losing weight on people. Yes, it is better to be healthy and fit when you get pregnant, it lessens the risks of gest diabetes, preeclampsia and all those things. But many people have perfectly healthy pregnancies that are overweight. The only thing I would notice is if you have any signs of polycystic ovarian syndrome and insulin resistance. I have that and I'm not overweight, but many people with larger abdomens have this insulin resistance, which can cause miscarriages. It caused my to have 3 before I figured it out and got on metformin. Signs of this are irregular cycles, facial hair and other hair in weird places, infertility, miscarriages, and many more. I only have irregular cycles, but they found my blood sugars a little out of wack and insulin levels high. Just something to think about!

you are very welcome.  Like I said before, you are my mom's height and weight and she's still a small person in my eyes!  I have friends who are your height and weighed much more when they conceived and had healthy pregnancies!  I'm glad you are finding another doc, this guy sounds so ridiculous!  Is this yoru first miscarriage?  If so, that is likely why he's not sending you to an RE.  It's jsut so common to miscarry so early on.  Usually it's only after 2 or 3 that they will send you to a specialist.
I just saw that this was yoru fourth m/c.  Don't know how I missed that!  Yes, he should be referring you to a specialist!  def. get a new doc!

140 LBS is not very overweight at all..and i highly doubt thats why you miscarried. But im not a dr. I do know though, many many ladies that are very overweight and have had no prob getting preg..and keeping it. A friend of mine is on her 3rd kid in 3 yrs already.(bigger girl)

Sorry about your loss. You are not over weight at all. Thats more than likely not the reason you miscarried. I am a big girl and I didn't have a prob with getting prego wth my first, I lost my second because I was a smoker up until I found out I was prego. Have you had tests done because there could be a underlying problem? You might need to supplement? Good luck to you.

im 5`9 over 270lbs m doctor didnt say nothing about me being over weight thats crazy and i even asked...i know women much bigger than me who have carried they`re babies and delivered your weight doesn`t seem like an issue but get a second opinion and im sorry to hear about your loss prayer answers all and cures all

I had to post because I am just apalled that your doctor would dare mention anything about your weight.  When I started reading your post I surely was not expecting you to say that at 5'3" you weighed 140!  As to even insinuate that a few pounds overweight has anything to do with your mc's is just so insulting.  I would say get a new doctor that is supportive and sensitive to what you have been through!  Good luck honey and don't let his comment affect you.  He is full of s**t!! Sorry about the language!
According to this website http://www.nhlbisupport.com/bmi/  which calculates bmi, your weight falls in the normal range.  You are not overweight to begin with!

question: I am really upset right now... well a couple of days ago, i learned that the child i am carrying died at 7 weeks... now I am waiting for it to pass, and I am completely devistated about that... well when i was speaking to my dr today, about possibly scheduling a d&c, he suggested that i should loose weight before trying to get pregnant again... I am 5'3 and weigh 140 , i am not extremely overweight... i could shed a few pounds, but overall, the weight is well distributed. Could being overweight really cause my m/C's?   I just feel like he almost attacked me with it, it has never come up before, and this is my 4th m/c.... has anybody ever heard anything like this before?
title: Is being overweight really that big of an issue?
